meanings.definition: To make a mess or a mistake.
meanings.sent1: Tom mucked up his room by spilling paint everywhere.
meanings.sent2: She mucked the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent3: The cat mucked up the yarn, creating a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The storm mucked the garden, scattering leaves and branches.
meanings.sent5: The children mucked the sandcastle, turning it into a pile of rubble.

meanings.definition: To clean out a horse's stall.
meanings.sent1: The farmer mucked the stable to keep it clean for the horses.
meanings.sent2: She mucked the stall every morning to ensure the horse's comfort.
meanings.sent3: The horse playfully kicked the mucked straw around the stall.
meanings.sent4: The fresh smell of mucked hay filled the barn after cleaning.
meanings.sent5: The mucked stall looked tidy and inviting for the horse.

meanings.sent1: Please don't muck with my computer settings; I have them just right.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to muck in other people's business, causing trouble.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mucked with the bird feeder, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her constant mucking in their relationship led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The curious child mucked with the puzzle, mixing up the pieces.
